intro: Crepis pygmaea var. mampodrensis, commonly known as the dwarf hawk's-beard, is a small flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments and thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are yellow with ray florets, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and delicate species.
